Detailed Description

HTML form object builder.

Description

This class is for building dynamic safe form objects. This works by constructing the object from the attributes provided below in the table. The built form object is returned rather than printed.

Author:
Elliot Chance

Definition at line 332 of file CMForm.php.

static CatchUpload ( $  name = 'upload'  )  [static]

Return true if a file si ready to be uploaded.

You can use this function with AJAX or normal HTML submitted forms. An example might be a page that submits to imageupload.php:

 <?php
 if(CMForm::CatchUpload()) {
   // there is a file being uploaded that we need to store
   // first check that it is a safe type
   if(!in_array(CMForm::UploadFileExtension(), array('jpg', 'gif', 'png'))
     die("You uploaded an invalid image type!");
   
   $destination = 'upload/' . substr(md5(rand()), 24) . CMForm::UploadFileExtension();
   CMForm::SaveUploadFile($destination);
  
   // the uploaded file will now be at a location like 'upload/34fde610.jpg'
 }
 ?>
Parameters:
$name The name of the HTML upload field. This defaults to 'upload' if not given.

Definition at line 483 of file CMForm.php.

static DefaultAttributes ( $  a  )  [static, private]

Internal use.

This function takes the user specified attributes and makes sure all the defaults and rules are set. This is really for internal use only. When an attribute does not exist it is given a default value specified from above.

Parameters:
$a Associative array of HTML attributes.
Returns:
Array of default elements filled in.

static HTMLEscape ( $  str  )  [static]

Escape double-quotes for HTML attribute value.

Your should not manually call this function as it will be called by the other functions as needed.

Parameters:
$str The string to parse.
Returns:
Parsed string for HTML attribute.

static MainAttributes ( $  a,
$  checkbox = false 
) [static, private]

Internal use.

Translates the main attributes into HTML.

Parameters:
$a Associative array of HTML attributes
$checkbox true if the object to be returned is a chackbox. This effects the name of the object so that checkboxes with the same name can be returned as an array.
Returns:
The main attributes required to build the base of an HTML object.

Definition at line 461 of file CMForm.php.

static Request ( $  objname  )  [static]

Get the safe value of posted form object.

If you are taking values from text boxes or text areas that contain single quotes the value will be escaped with backslashes. This function grabs a posted varaible and escapes, or recursivly escapes the values to return the true posted value.

Parameters:
$objname This is the field name, not the string itself.
Returns:
Safe value. This may be a string or an array.
See also:
Get()
Post()

$  name = 'upload' 
) [static]

Definition at line 262 of file CMForm.php.

static UploadFileExtension ( $  name = 'upload'  )  [static]

Return the extension of the uploaded file (not including the dot.).

If the uploaded file was 'something.jpg' then UploadFileExtension() would return jpg

Parameters:
$name The name of the HTML upload field. This defaults to 'upload' if not given.
